climbs.name: THIS CLIMB (has) RULZ !
climbs.fa: JBaker, JWodraska, RRingle, JNeilson, JShiefman, Mar 2019

content.description:
Yeah I know climbs can't have rules.  But this one does. Kind of like bouldering where some holds are OFF.

 Luckily the rule is simple: Don't use the arete until the big white knob even with the fifth bolt. Close to the arete is okay, just not ON it.

 The bolts have been carefully Bakified to keep you away from the arete.

 The route is complicated, sustained, and fingery with good movement. Overhangs 5 or 6 feet in 35.
content.location: As you switchback up and right, and then back left from the Discard Pile you will see a little tower. Right-most line of bolts.

content.description: More slightly overhung fingery goodness.  Gets harder as you go with crux at the end.
content.location: Left-hand bolt line on High Stakes Tower.

content.description:
Short, slightly overhung, fingery goodness. Sunny in AM but gets shade before noon.

 BONUS... Much less road noise.

 I'm sure this crag was seen by Luke and Kemper when they were doing the original CAH routes... there is a trail going right by it.  Josie and I passed by it while coming back from looking at yet another set of crags.  We thought "why not ?".
